fields_of_interest: Education and training, Youth, Research and innovation, Public Health
eu_initiatives:
We follow EU health and safety regulations, fertility/infertility treatments regulations, reproductive health education and prevention, laws and regulations about infertility treatments in EU countries, patients safety and quality of care. 
Because patient safety is an area of national competence, we focuse on a collaborative approach and exchange of best practice action at European level.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
We are currently working on the European Policy Audit on Fertility (EPAF). The EPAF is a joint project of Fertility Europe and European Society of Human Reproduction and Embryology (ESHRE) conducted under unrestricted grant of Merck. The document covers the general information on situation in Europe with a detailed coverage of 9 countries: Czech Republic, Germany, France, Italy, Poland, Romania, Spain, Sweden and the UK.  
 
Data gathering was based on desk research and interviews with FE members whenever applicable and ESHRE representatives. The EPAF will make a comprehensive source of information and a great advocacy tool. It is also one of the most extensive project FE has taken part in so far.  
 
The Policy Audit will be launched in the European Parliament in Brussels on the 28th of March 2017.
goals__remit:
-build a strong European network among European patients and professionals in order to achieve the exchange of best practise 
-promote education in the field of protection of reproductive health and a pro-active approach to family planning 
-improve the situation concerning the rights of those affected by difficulties in conceiving in many areas 
-allow access to fertility treatment and assisted reproduction without discrimination 
-promote fertility support 
-promote prevention in the areas of fertility
